title: Introduction to dental CBCT image analysis using semi-supervised learning for K-12: Mathematical modeling and equation-based approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics (algebra, geometry, statistics, probability) and computer literacy; comprehension of formula interpretation and graphical representation
context.additional_context: Targeting general citizens without prior knowledge of medical imaging analysis, this program aims to educate applicable mathematical modeling (measurement, analysis, proof) and semi-automated analysis techniques in real-life contexts. Emphasizes cultivating computational skills, problem-solving abilities, and equation-based approaches required for interpreting medical data.

learning_goals: Explain the basic principles of semi-supervised learning and apply mathematical analysis techniques (measurements, graphs, statistics) to medical image analysis.
Understand and demonstrate equation-based modeling and graph representation methods for identifying anatomical structures in CBCT imaging
Practice probabilistic modeling, statistical techniques, and optimization problem-solving methods to enhance lesion detection accuracy with limited labeled data
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
